Comment: Protests and rallies work!  I see a lot of grey-hairs like me there because a lot of have seen how effective the Civil-Rights and Vietnam War protests were. Elected representatives depend on the approval of large blocks of people and seeing a bunch of people saying "I'm not OK with this" really makes them nervous.  It only takes 1-2 hours to join a rally and help add to the crowd.  I really appreciate these rallies bing on Saturday where possible, so working people like me can attend.  Silence is surrender, it's time to make some noise.
Author: Iowa_Dave

He’s about shock and awe. Look what he did to the people he sent to El Salvador. There’s people who were not supposed to be sent and they’re still there. Like WTF.
Author: thomport

Comment: The Civil Rights and Vietnam War protests occurred in the 20th century when everyone got their news from the same three and very similar networks.    In the 21st century the media has been much more fragmented and siloed and most people don't even know these protests are happening.    I've been to seven protests so far and they were all overwhelmingly boomers. If you can show any concrete evidence that peaceful protests in the 21st century actually produce concrete results I'd like to see it.    Are Black people in the hands of the police demonstrably safer now than they were before BLM?   Is the status of women any better now after the Women's March?   Is the US doing a better job protecting the environment than we were before the Extinction Rebellion protests?   Have the 1% been taken down a peg or two since Occupy?   I intend to continue going to anti-Trump protests because they're fun and it's nice to be with other people feel the same way I do.   But I see no evidence that peacefully waving placards around has any effect on the Trump administration.
Author: Independent-Roof-774
